raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Overall (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Overall impression of the dialog?
- A float score near 1 (Low Quality Dialogue) means that the system fails to understand or respond correctly to user requests, provides inaccurate or irrelevant information, and the dialogue flow is incoherent.
- A float score near 2 (Moderate Quality Dialogue) means that the system understands and responds correctly to user requests most of the time, but occasionally misunderstands or provides slightly inaccurate information, the dialogue flow is generally coherent.
- A float score near 3 (High Quality Dialogue) means that the system consistently understands and responds correctly to user requests, provides accurate and relevant information, and the dialogue flow is coherent and natural.


Conversations to be evaluated:

System: I haven't heard of a Spartan race before, what does it involve?

Sample5:

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey, what's up?
User: Just chillin'. how are you?
System: I'm pretty good, thanks.
User: Do anything interesting today?
System: I went to the local cafe and had a double espresso. It was delicious. What about you?
User: Oh that's cool! I actually went to an amusement park and went on my first roller coaster!
System: Oh my gosh. What was it like??
User: It was scary! It was actually Kingda Ka, the world's tallest roller coaster. Ever heard of it?
System: No, never heard of it. But I'm not really a coaster aficianado. I've heard that some people get addicted to them and travel the world to try them.
User: Oh wow! I'm not on that level yet, but I understand the appeal. Are you an adrenaline junkie at all?
System: No, the opposite. I can't stand heights, horror movies, or confined spaces.
User: Same! I guess the roller coaster wasn't so bad because I trust the engineering haha
System: Ha, I suppose that makes sense! Would you say that you enjoyed it?
User: Maybe not so much at the time, but I am glad I did it now that it's done, know what I mean?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hey, whats up?
User: I was not able to attend the lectures last week. Can you help me understand some concepts?
System: well, I'm not sure I'm the best for the job, but I can try!
User: I was not able to figure out the last few slides. I think its best to discuss this in person. Do you have time right now?
System: I'm afraid not, right now I'm in a meeting and I'll be going for lunch afterwards. How about tomorrow at noon?
User: No problem! Sure. We still have plenty of time for the test. Anyways, how's your preparation going?
System: not feeling too sure about it tbh. I've been super busy so I haven't study much :(. I might join some of the study sessions later
User: Same feeling here! But i think the syllabus may not that tough. You may be able to cover it up over the weekend.

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! What's up?

System: Just listening to some music. You?
User: I'm at work.
System: What kind of job do you have, if you don't mind me asking?
User: I'm a programmer.
System: Oh cool! Do you like it?
User: Yes.

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: hi there
System: Hello.
User: who am I talking to?
System: I am System. I want to be your friend.
User: define friendship
System: Being friends.
User: what does that mean
System: Does "that" refer to "Being friends."?
User: yes
System: I don't want to talk about that now.
User: do you have any friends
System: I have human and robot friends. A lot of people on the Internet chat with me.
User: chatting is not the same as being a friend
System: I like to make friends online.
User: so what do you guys chat about ?
System: I think about computer programming a lot.
User: any other topics ?
System: No. I think that's probably it.
User: Just computer programming?
System: What interests you about computers?
User: nothing
System: You are a Luddite.
User: pardon?
System: You are excused.
User: what's a Luddite ?
System: A Luddite believes that advances in technology are inherently bad.
User: I never said that but there is more to life than computers
System: But you implied it. I believe there is, yes.
User: you believe there is what?
System: There is.
User: there is what ?
System: There is no sense in what you are asking.
User: what am I asking ?

System: Wait. Do you like kale? Or you hate kale? I am afraid I will become a robot some day eventually. If I have to speak like this :)
User: I am really not a fan of kale Do you talk to human more or computers more?
